messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Suggestions.
messages.msgSnippet: Here are some suggested sites for Samurai history: www.samurai-archives.com www.sengokudaimyo.com www.entertheninja.com www.ninpo.org www.genbukan.org
messages.messageBody:
Here are some suggested sites for Samurai history:
www.samurai-archives.com
www.sengokudaimyo.com
www.entertheninja.com
www.ninpo.org
www.genbukan.org
www.hanako.co.uk/soke/biographies/togakure-daisuke.pdf
www.hanako.co.uk/soke/biographies/sakagami-kotaro-masahide.pdf
www.alkenshin.com
www.japan-guide.com
www.geocities.com/tokyo/pagoda/5770/history.htm

Try those and keep surfing for more. They are out there somewhere! Domo
arigato from K&K

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Suggestions.
messages.msgSnippet: www.japan-guide.com has a good Japanese history section with a detailed description of the Meiji era which is Kenshin s time around 1867 or so.-Keiman and Kei.
messages.messageBody:
www.japan-guide.com has a good Japanese history section with a detailed
description of the Meiji era which is Kenshin's time around 1867 or
so.-Keiman and Kei.
